description: Late shift: Daria Tomenko, reflecting on her brother's fate and disillusioned with Council control, authorizes the erasure protocol and deletes thousands of BCI profiles—knowing it will strand citizens but break corrupted influence.
Thousands awaken to find their BCI records wiped. Jobs, housing, and services become inaccessible, causing confusion and panic across affected districts.
In the data void, new 'amnesiac' communities organize for mutual aid, relying on local trust and barter. High-score citizens quietly offer support, sensing the system's collapse.
A thriving black market for fake BCI profiles, forged testimonials, and communal passwords emerges. The Council’s containment efforts only fuel the underground networks.
Most erased citizens embrace informal social life and ignore BCI mandates. Their resilience inspires others, spreading open defiance and weakening Council legitimacy citywide.
